intro: Barleria solanifolia, commonly known as the purple barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are usually purple or pink in color. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a distinctive velvety texture. Barleria solanifolia is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
